title: The iPrevent Online Breast Cancer Risk Assessment and Risk Management Tool: Usability and Acceptability Testing
abstract: The iPrevent prototype demonstrated good usability and acceptability. Because concerns about length could be an implementation barrier, data entry has been abbreviated in the publicly available version of iPrevent.
full_text:
Appendix 1: Breast Cancer Prevention Knowledge Questionnaire
The next 16 questions ask you about breast cancer risk factors and screening. 
Please indicate for each item whether it is True, False, or if you Don’t know.
1. Regular moderate exercise does not reduce your risk of 
breast cancer
 True       False     
 Don’t know
2. Maintaining a healthy weight is important for minimising 
breast cancer risk
 True       False     
 Don’t know
3. You should promptly report any new or unusual changes in 
your breasts to your GP
 True       False     
 Don’t know
4. Screening mammograms are recommended every two years 
for women aged 50-74 years
 True       False     
 Don’t know
5. Using hormone replacement therapy (HRT) may decrease 
your risk of breast cancer
 True       False     
 Don’t know
6. About 1% (10 in 1000) of Australian women will develop 
breast cancer in their lifetime
 True       False     
 Don’t know
7. Consuming alcohol can decrease your risk of breast cancer  True       False     
 Don’t know
8. The more children you have, and the earlier you have them, 
the lower your risk of breast cancer
 True       False     
 Don’t know
9. Breast feeding can increase your risk of breast cancer  True       False     
 Don’t know
10. Mammograms reduce your risk of developing breast cancer  True       False     
 Don’t know
11. Medications such as Tamoxifen may reduce your risk of 
breast cancer
 True       False     
 Don’t know
12. Medications such as Tamoxifen are recommended to be 
taken for 1 year
 True       False     
 Don’t know
13. Taking medications such as Tamoxifen is not recommended 
for women with a history of blood clots or those who smoke
 True       False     
 Don’t know
14. Your breast cancer risk can be slightly increased while you 
are using a hormonal contraceptive, such as the 
contraceptive pill
 True       False     
 Don’t know
15. Risk-reducing mastectomy means removing as much breast 
tissue as possible before a cancer develops
 True       False     
 Don’t know
16. A woman who has her breasts removed will definitely not 
develop breast cancer
 True       False     
 Don’t know
